member.summary: Base error code of the Face module.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.Minimum
member.summary: Minimum error code of the Face module.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InvalidHandle
member.summary: The handle is invalid.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InvalidParameter
member.summary: The parameter is invalid.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InsufficientBuffer
member.summary: The given buffer is too small.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InvalidPixelFormat
member.summary: The image pixel format is invalid.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InvalidTemplateFormat
member.summary: The template format is invalid.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InvalidLandmarks
member.summary: The computed landmarks are invalid and do not allow to process the desired information.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InvalidIod
member.summary: The computed interocular distance (IOD) is invalid and does not allow to process the desired information.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InvalidModelPath
member.summary: The model could not be found in the given directory path.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.UnloadedModel
member.summary: The model which is required for this operation was not loaded.

member.name: F:id3.Face.FaceError.InferenceBackendError
member.summary: The inference backend failed to infer, probably due to inconsistent input.

member.name: M:id3.Face.FaceDetector.TrackFaces(id3.Face.Image,id3.Face.DetectedFaceList)
member.summary: Tracks faces in an image and update their info in a DetectedFaceList object. The algorithm searches for faces in the range [16px;512px]. If the image is too large to fit this range, one must resize it before the detection process. In a realtime process, one must use this function instead of "detect" to keep the face IDs stable in time.
member.param: Source image to process.
List of detected faces.

Detected face to process.
member.returns: Computed blurriness score. In the range [0:100].
member.exception: An error has occured during Face library execution.

member.name: M:id3.Face.FacePad.ComputeColorBasedScore(id3.Face.Image,id3.Face.DetectedFace)
member.summary: Computes the PAD score of a detected face using only the color image. A high score means a high probability for the face to be bona-fide, hence not an attack. The minimum recommended value is 50.
member.param: Source image to process.
Detected face to process.
member.returns: Computed PAD score. In the range [0:100].
member.exception: An error has occured during Face library execution.

member.name: M:id3.Face.FacePad.ComputeDepthBasedScore(id3.Face.Image,id3.Face.DetectedFace)
member.summary: Computes the PAD score of a detected face using a depth map image. A high score means a high probability for the face to be bona-fide, hence not an attack. The minimum recommended value is 10.
member.param: Source image to process. Must be Grayscale 16 Bits.
Detected face to process.
member.returns: Computed PAD score. In the range [0:100].
member.exception: An error has occured during Face library execution.

member.name: M:id3.Face.FacePad.ComputeMoireScore(id3.Face.Image,id3.Face.DetectedFace)
member.summary: Computes the Moir score of a detected face using a color image. An attack presented on a screen will likely present Moir effects whereas a bonafide will not. The maximum recommended value is 10.
member.param: Source image to process.
Detected face to process.
member.returns: Computed Moir score. In the range [0:100].
member.exception: An error has occured during Face library execution.

member.name: M:id3.Face.License.LoadLicense(System.String)
member.summary:
Loads and checks a license from a file.
This function does two things: - First it loads the license from a file using the given path - Then it checks the validity of the license regarding the host it is called on (Windows, Linux, Android ...)
Calling this function is required to get access to the license member getters.
The optional parameter is required on Android and must be the JNIEnv* pointer casted as a void*. It can be set as NULL for other devices.
member.param: Absolute or relative path to the license file.
member.exception: An error has occured during Face library execution.

member.name: M:id3.Face.License.LoadLicenseBuffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Loads and checks a license from a buffer.
This function does two things: - First it loads the license from a buffer - Then it checks the validity of the license regarding the host it is called on (Windows, Linux, Android ...)
Calling one of the license loading function is required to get access to all the license member getters.
The optional parameter is required on Android and must be the JNIEnv* pointer casted as a void*. It can be set as NULL for other devices.
member.param: A buffer containing the license file data.
member.exception: An error has occured during Face library execution.

member.name: T:id3.Face.FaceAttributes
member.summary: This structure represents a FaceAttributes object of the Face module.

members.member: Value indicating whether the person is wearing glasses or not. 100 means that the person is definitely wearing glasses. The minimum recommended threshold is 10.
Value indicating whether the person is wearing a hat or not. 100 means that the person is definitely wearing a hat. The minimum recommended threshold is 10.
Value indicating whether the person is wearing make-up or not. 100 means that the person is definitely wearing make-up. The minimum recommended threshold is 50.

Value indicating whether the person is a male or a female. A value close to 0 means that the person is estimated to be female. A value close to 100 means that the person is estimated to be male. The recommended threshold is 50.
Value indicating whether the person's mouth is open or not. 100 means that the person's mouth is definitely open. The minimum recommended threshold is 35.
Value indicating whether the person is smiling or not. 100 means that the person is definitely smiling. The minimum recommended threshold is 75.

member.name: M:id3.Face.FaceAttributes.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

Value indicating whether the person is wearing a hat or not. 100 means that the person is definitely wearing a hat. The minimum recommended threshold is 10. Value indicating whether the person is wearing make-up or not. 100 means that the person is definitely wearing make-up. The minimum recommended threshold is 50. Value indicating whether the person is a male or a female. A value close to 0 means that the person is estimated to be female. A value close to 100 means that the person is estimated to be male. The recommended threshold is 50. Value indicating whether the person's mouth is open or not. 100 means that the person's mouth is definitely open. The minimum recommended threshold is 35. Value indicating whether the person is smiling or not. 100 means that the person is definitely smiling. The minimum recommended threshold is 75.

member.name: T:id3.Face.GeometricAttributes
member.summary: This structure represents a GeometricAttributes object of the Face module.

members.member: Value indicating if the distance between the base of the chin and the crown is less than 80% of the total height of the image. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 60 to 90.

Value indicating if the image width is conform to the (image width / head width) ratio of 7:5. The head width is defined as the distance between the left and right ears. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 50 to 75.
Value indicating if the head is correctly centered horizontally. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 45 to 55.
Value indicating if the image resolution is sufficient. The minimum recommended value is 90.

Value indicating if the distance from the bottom edge of the image to the imaginary line passing through the center of the eyes is between 50% - 70% of the total vertical length of the image. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 30 to 50.

member.name: M:id3.Face.GeometricAttributes.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GeometricAttributes structure from its members. Value indicating if the distance between the base of the chin and the crown is less than 80% of the total height of the image. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 60 to 90. Value indicating if the image width is conform to the (image width / head width) ratio of 7:5. The head width is defined as the distance between the left and right ears. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 50 to 75. Value indicating if the head is correctly centered horizontally. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 45 to 55. Value indicating if the image resolution is sufficient. The minimum recommended value is 90. Value indicating if the distance from the bottom edge of the image to the imaginary line passing through the center of the eyes is between 50% - 70% of the total vertical length of the image. For ICAO compliance, the value must be in the range 30 to 50.
